task.en: There is a 2x2 table in one of my notes titled "Lorem Ipsum". In that table, please help me fill in `Lorem` in the top-left cell, `Ipsum` in the top-right cell, `Dolor` in the bottom-left cell, and `Sit` in the bottom-right cell.
task.zh: 我有一篇名为Lorem Ipsum的备忘录中包含一个2x2的表格。请帮我在那个表格中填写内容：左上角填Lorem，右上角填Ipsum，左下角Dolor，右下角Sit。
task.ar: هناك جدول 2x2 في إحدى ملاحظاتي بعنوان "Lorem Ipsum". في هذا الجدول، يرجى ملء ما يلي: `Lorem` في الخلية العلوية اليسرى، `Ipsum` في الخلية العلوية اليمنى، `Dolor` في الخلية السفلية اليسرى، و`Sit` في الخلية السفلية اليمنى.
task.ja: 「Lorem Ipsum」というタイトルのメモに2x2の表があります。その表で、左上セルに `Lorem`、右上セルに `Ipsum`、左下セルに `Dolor`、右下セルに `Sit` を記入してください。
task.ru: В одной из заметок под названием "Lorem Ipsum" есть таблица 2x2. Заполните её следующим образом: в левую верхнюю ячейку впишите `Lorem`, в правую верхнюю – `Ipsum`, в левую нижнюю – `Dolor`, а в правую нижнюю – `Sit`.

pre_command:
defaults write com.apple.Notes windowStateArchive -dict-add currentNoteContainerViewMode 0 && osascript -e 'tell application "Notes" to make new note with properties {name:"Lorem Ipsum", body:"Dolor Sit Amet"}' && osascript -e 'tell application "Notes" to delete every note' -e 'tell application "Notes" to delete every note in folder "Recently Deleted"' && osascript -e 'tell application "Notes" to make new note with properties {body:"

Matterhorn Man


Modern alpinists try to climb mountains by a route which will give them good sport, and the more difficult it is, the more highly it is regarded. In the pioneering days, however, this was not the case at all. The early climbers were looking for the easiest way to the top, because the summit was the prize they sought, especially if it and never been attained before. It is true that during their explorations they often faced difficulties and dangers of the most perilous nature, equipped in a manner with would make a modern climber shudder at the thought, but they did not go out of their way to court such excitement. They had a single aim, a solitary goal -- the top!

It is hard for us to realize nowadays how difficult it was for the pioneers. Except for one or two places such as Zermatt and Chamonix, which had rapidly become popular, Alpine village tended to be impoverished settlements cut off from civilization by the high mountains. Such inns as there were generally dirty and flea-ridden; the food simply local cheese accompanied by bread often twelve months old, all washed down with coarse wine. Often a valley boasted no inn at all, and climbers found shelter wherever they could -- sometimes with the local priest (who was usually as poor as his parishioners), sometimes with shepherds or cheese-makers. Invariably the background was the same: dirt and poverty, and very uncomfortable. For men accustomed to eating seven-course dinners and sleeping between fine linen sheets at home, the change to the Alps must have very hard indeed.
"}' && osascript -e 'tell application "Notes" to make new note with properties {body:"

Lorem Ipsum

Dolor Sit Amet

"}' && osascript -e 'tell application "Notes" to quit'
grading_command:
osascript -e 'tell application "Notes" to get the body of every note' 2>/dev/null | tr -d '\n' 2>/dev/null | sed -E 's/<(td|tr)[^>]*>/<>/g' 2>/dev/null | grep -q "
Lorem
Ipsum
Dolor
Sit

" && echo "True" || echo "False"
